answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found some sample noise ordinances.
This is a sample noise ordinance from Allentown, PA. Sections 8 and 9 cover the particular devices you are interested in.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/1926/Noise_Ordinance
This ordinance from Sunnyvale, CA covers leaf blowers and operational noises.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/3647/Overview_of_City_Noise_Issues
Here is a similar ordinance from Stillwater, MN.
http://www.ci.stillwater.mn.us/index.asp?Type=B_BASIC&SEC={2EC2F2C4-F809-46EB-8711-4CFF1405665E}
This link goes to a number of different noise ordinances from cities in Washington.
http://www.mrsc.org/subjects/legal/nuisances/nu-noise.aspx#motor
The City of Palo Alto, CA has an ordinance just for leaf blowers.
http://www.cityofpaloalto.org/depts/pol/news/details.asp?NewsID=671&TargetID=96
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Sharon Ergler
text: The Borough of State is looking for examples of noise ordinances from other municipalities that regulate the use of gas powered leaf blowers, lawn mowers, and snow blowers in residential districts.
title: Noise Ordinances regulating residential gas powered equipment in residential zones
